ygData.subject: Re: Place of Dreams.
ygData.msgSnippet: Tavatron continued to laugh softly, she was thoroughly enjoying herself. She kept her head level with Dinobot’s so as not to throw him off balance, but made

To: nbwrpg@egroups.com
Subject: Re: Place of Dreams.
Date: Thu, 03 Aug 2000 19:19:57 EDT
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; format=flowed
From: "FIRE FOX" <firefox_y2k@...>

Tavatron continued to laugh softly, she was thoroughly enjoying herself. She 
kept her head level with Dinobot�s so as not to throw him off balance, but 
made sure she wasn�t holding on as tightly as before.  At first she had been 
quite uncomfortable with the notion of riding a dinosaur, much less a fellow 
warrior, but after a while she had grown quite used to this mode of 
�transportation�.  Tavatron continued to gaze forward, her optics eagerly 
searching out their destination. They couldn�t be far now, though she had 
absolutely no idea where they were going. She noticed that Dinobot had 
increased his pace, turning the surrounding flora into nothing but a brown 
and green blur. She chanced a glance to the side, only get  smacked upside 
the head by a rogue tree branch. It was a small one, not enough to make her 
fall but enough to cause a considerable amount of stinging. Tavatron shook 
her head in annoyance. Still, despite what had just happened all in all this 
really wasn�t that bad.

Tavatron�s optics darted to the side, she made sure not to turn her head 
this time, less she get hit again. She thought she saw something splatter 
against the tree as Dinobot continued to leap in a criss-cross fashion. 
Before she could say anything about it Dinobot seemed to almost spasm, but 
Tavatron dismissed it as overworked muscles. Unless he was injured. Tavatron 
suddenly found herself quite concerned for the safety of her traveling 
companion, and anxiously awaited the chance to look him over and assure 
herself he was alright. She would have scanned him, but her scanners seemed 
to be inoperable. Oh well, if it was anything serious he would have told 
her. Then again, he was Dinobot, even when injury was evident he still had 
assured her he was fine.

Tavatron almost gasped in shock as they came to a rather hard landing atop 
an old, weathered stump at the edge of a breathtaking clearing. It was 
beautiful! If she had known this world held such beauty she would never have 
set foot inside a base again. Tavatron continued to gaze in amazement at her 
wonderful surroundings. The grass smelled soft with a hint of sweetness to 
it. Her beast mode told her it was sweetgrass, though she had absolutely no 
idea what sweetgrass was. The water smelled fresh and cold, the clear mist 
gently caressing her face. She had completely forgotten about the Alliance 
and their potential recapture. Tavatron�s eyes remained glued to the small 
waterfall as she deeply breathed in all the scents around her. She let out 
her breath in one long, contented sigh as she gazed above at a thick canopy 
of leaves. The small sun spots on the ground seemed to dance and sparkle as 
Dinobot made his way down the stump and toward the water. His walked seemed 
to have a slight limp to it, causing Tavatron to once again wonder whether 
or not he had sustained any damage earlier:

"This place, it�s amazing. I�ve never seen anything like it.."

Out of the corner of her eye something seemed to flash slightly, causing her 
shift so as to get a better view. It was Dinobot�s armor. It was reflecting 
the light quite beautifully. Her armor never did that, and she found herself 
becoming slightly jealous of the fact that his armor seemed to bebetter 
looking than hers, not to mention in better condition. Tavatron sighed 
contentedly as she began to pick small branches and leaves from her fur, 
carelessly tossing them aside. As they reached the water Tavatron couldn�t 
help but stare at her reflection in the babbling brook. The clover growing 
along the edge was exceptionally beautiful. Though something seemed a little 
odd about it.

Suddenly a rush of color and fluttering wings greeted her inquisitive stare 
as multiple butterflies took flight. When Dinobot had lowered his snout to 
drink he must have disturbed them. Tavatron playfully batted at the small 
creatures, careful not to injure any of them. Suddenly the sound of 
screeching tires and the rustling of nearby brush broke her concentration. 
Some �bot had followed them! So much for peace and relaxation! Tavatron dove 
to the side as Hakibuscon fired his missileat them, letting it harmlessly 
pass overhead as she rolled through the grass, coming into a crouched stance 
a few feet away:

"What the slag do you want?"
